newsitem.title: UK: All Nippon raise ex-UK cargo rates.
newsitem.headline: All Nippon raise ex-UK cargo rates.

text.p: Japan's All Nippon Airways is increasing its ex-UK cargo rates by six pence a kilo with effect from December one, its assistent manager for cargo John O'Shea told Reuters.
The increase is being made in market rates and not as a surcharge which would need regulatory approval by the Japan Civil Aviation Bureau (JCAB).
At this stage O'Shea said the rate increase is only on eastbound flights.

Air Nippon introduced an increase of 15 pfennig a kilo from Germany which took effect from November 15. Both this and the UK increase are the local currency equivalents of the 10 US cent/kg surcharge imposed by many international carriers. -- Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
